p: In 2017, 1 750 ZIKV cases were reported, of which 57 were laboratory confirmed. The departments with the most ZIKV cases were Valle del Cauca, Santander, Tolima, Cundinamarca, and Meta, representing 65.7% (95% CI: 65.0%–66.1%) of all cases. An analysis by age and gender showed that 55.4% (95% CI: 55.0%–56.1%) of cases occurred in women; 27.9% (95% CI: 24.4%–31.6%) occurred in children younger than 1 year; 13.3% (95% CI: 13.0%–14.1%) occurred in those 25 to 29 years old; and 12.7% (95% CI: 12.1%–13.4%) occurred in persons 20 to 24 years old. Since the beginning of 2017, 388 cases have been identified in pregnant women who reported having symptoms compatible with ZIKV infection. Pregnant women represented 22.1% (95% CI: 20.2-24.1%) of all ZIKV cases, and 38 (14.3%; 95% CI: 13.9%–15.1%) of the cases in pregnant women were laboratory confirmed.
